text: Is there a builtin like `filter` but returns two arrays depending if the predicate is true or false (instead of returning one array for the trues)?

text:
```function accumulator(predicate, x, y)
  trues = first(x)
  falses = second(x)
  if predicate(y)
    push!(trues, y)
  else
    push!(falses, y)
  end
  return (trues, falses)
end

double_filter(predicate, iter) = foldl(
  (x, y) -> accumulator(predicate, x, y),
  iter,
  init=([], [])
)```
